trans-unit.source: Adjust the way how SmartBerry handles climate control.
You can set the mode of all your radiators at once. Additionally, SmartBerry turn radiators off, if windows or doors are openend. Current modes are OFF, ON, ECO and POWER.
In order to let SmartBerry handle all radiators for you, organize your radiator items as shown below.
Adjust the commands sent to the heating mode item for each available state. Current choices are OFF (0.0), ON (1.0), ECO (2.0) or POWER` (3.0)
You can define contact items that automatically turn off heating in open state.
The last irrigation of your valve started at and completed at . For the last 30 days a total amount of had been irrigated.
An irrigation is planned for today.
Adjust the way how SmartBerry handles the irrigation of your garden.
Start to manage the irrigation of your garden! Set the OpenWeather API token and make sure to subscribe to the One Call API 3.0 and to set your location in your openHAB location settings.
The location of the weather forecast (, ) is with your openHAB location settings.
In order to let SmartBerry handle all irrigation valves for you, organize your valve items as shown below.
In order to achieve an optimal irrigation, adjust the following values to your satisfaction.
Irrigation Level Per Minute (mm): How much water will be irrigated by the valve upon your plants? 1.0 liter per square meter is equal to 1.0 millimeter.
Example: You have an area of 10 m¬≤ and your valve pours 10 l per minute. Consequently, you have a irrigation level of 1.0 mm per minute (10 l / 10 m¬≤ = 1.0 l/m¬≤ ‚âô 1.0 mm).
Evaporation Factor: Increase or decrease the evaporation per day that is based on the Hargreaves‚ÄìSamani model. Set it above 1 to increase evaporation, set it below 1 to decrease evaporation.
Minimal Temperature: Skips any irrigation triggers, if the temperature of the upcoming or last seven days has gone below the minimal temperature.
Bucket Size (days): Defines the range of days SmartBerry monitors the precipitation rate and decides to trigger irrigation.
Extend Bucket upon Future Rainfalls (days): Maximum number of days SmartBerry will postpone irrigation on upcoming rain, although precipitation level cannot be maintained.

Assuming no rain and an evaporation of 1.0 mm a day, your plants need mm ( l/m¬≤) per day. Your valve irrigates mm ( l/m¬≤) per minute. Consequently the valve will irrigate for , if there was no rain for .
You can define irrigation trigger items that automatically start the irrigation check. Any state change of these items will fire an irrigation event.
The following items comply with the schema
Adjust the way how SmartBerry handles your lighting.
Lights are triggered automatically in dependence to daylight and presence changes. Get started with a proper lights configuration by tagging your light items as light switchables.

SmartBerry will add manageable items to each location having light switchable items to let you adjust it's particular light configuration. Set the lighting mode in each location for dark, obscured and bright conditions. To do so, edit the generated members of gCore_Lights_DarkMode, gCore_Lights_ObscuredMode and gCore_Lights_BrightMode. Current choices are:

Light switchable items in locations with a lighting mode of AUTO_ON will turn off after a given time without presence events. Change Core_Lights_DefaultDuration to adjust the number of minutes until lights are turned off automatically.

If presence changes from AWAY_SHORT or AWAY_LONG to HOME, you can turn on all light switchable items in locations having the lighting mode set to AUTO_ON automatically. To do so, enable the corresponding welcome light item:
Core_Lights_WelcomeLight_DarkMode to enable welcome lights during dark light conditions.
Core_Lights_WelcomeLight_ObscuredMode to enable welcome lights during obscured light conditions.
Core_Lights_WelcomeLight_BrightMode to enable welcome lights during bright light conditions.

SmartBerry analyzes light measurement items to identify the actual light conditions and change the state of Core_Lights_AmbientLightCondition accordingly. Note that light measurement items of locations with at least one active light switchable item are not put into consideration.
If no considerable light measurement items are available, SmartBerry can also use the sun state of an astro item to determine the actual light conditions.

Adjust the tresholds of Core_Lights_AmbientLightCondition_LuminanceTreshold_Obscured and Core_Lights_AmbientLightCondition_LuminanceTreshold_Dark to change the upper luminance level for obscured and dark light conditions.
Adjust the way how SmartBerry reacts to presence changes.

The presence management will automatically adjust the presence state of a location and the entire home in dependence to the last presence detection events. In SmartBerry Core_Presence reflects the presence status of your entire home and has three states:

Set the number of hours in Core_Presence_HoursUntilAwayShort until presence management sets the presence state to AWAY_SHORT. Set the number of hours in Core_Presence_HoursUntilAwayLong until presence management sets the presence state to AWAY_LONG.
In order to trigger presence, you should define presence items, e.g. by tagging your motion sensors.
You may restrict the states of a presence item triggering presence - by default these states are ON and OPEN. You can also define states triggering absence.
Presence states defaults to ON and OPEN.
Adjust the way how SmartBerry handles scenes.
Scenes allow multiple devices to be controlled with a single command. In SmartBerry Core_DefaultScene is the preconfigured default scene and has four states:
Scene states of user defined scenes can be changed. Edit or add the scene item's State Description and enter each scene state under Options on a separate line, e.g.
When finished, trigger item Core_Scenes_ReloadStates to reinitialize all scene states.

A scene saves the states of all light switchable items within the same location for every single scene state. You can change this behavior and use custom scene members instead. Select Add default members to include all light switchables as well.
You cannot change custom members of the default scene.
Scenes can also react to context changes by changing its state value. The following context states are predefined and called by the default scene upon changes: home, away-short, away-long, sleep.
By using rules, you can apply a context by calling apply_context('your custom context').
When a scene trigger item is triggered, it changes a given scene state.
Each scene creates scene trigger items for every scene state by default. However, you can define custom scene trigger items by tagging them with CoreSceneTrigger.
You may tag a motion sensor to be a custom scene trigger to reset the default scene automatically.
You cannot adjust generated trigger items.
Any state updates will change your scene state.
Only if scene conditions are met
Adjust the way how SmartBerry secures your home.

The security system protects your home and responds to any unauthorized activity. If openHAB-Cloud and the operation state is set up properly, SmartBerry notifies you as soon as smoke or an assault had been detected. Adjust the operation state by editing Core_Security_OperationState. Current choices are:
You may let items disable the operation state automatically. Assault disarmer items turn off the operation state, if the item state changed to ON or OPEN.
Tag your doors or windows as assault trigger items to enable assault detection. Any state change of these items will fire an assault event during an active operation state.

To enable assault alarms right after an assault detection, tag the corresponding siren or security system as assault alarm item. You can change the duration until the alarm will turn off automatically by editing the Core_Security_AssaultAlarmAutoOff item. Set to zero to disable the auto-off functionality.
Lock items may be closed by a closed door or window contact. This way, you do not need to lock it yourself. To get started, tag your locks in order to match with the following schema:
Next, tag your window or door contact within the same location as lock closure items. Any lock closure item reacts to OFF and CLOSED and will close a lock item within the same location right away.
Tag your smoke detector items and match the following schema to enable smoke detection upon fire.
Authenticate to your openHAB-Instance to adjust addional settings.
Set your openHAB API token to use more configuration options for SmartBerry.
